text: On a high oak tree, a nightingale sang as usual. A hungry gavel saw him, and immediately hurling over him, he caught him in his claws. Sure of his next death, the nightingale begged him to let him go, telling him that he would not be enough to fill his belly, and that if he was really hungry, he should catch another bigger one. And the dove said, I am a fool, if I hear thee, and let the prey that I have escape, and go and seek it, which I have not seen. Better a bird in the hand than a hundred flying.
title: El ruiseñor y el gavilán
author: nan Esopo
